items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã499 ‚Äî July 14, 2021 | Read on the web

Towards Richer Colors on the Web ‚Äî A detailed piece covering the efforts to add richer colors to the Web platform and why that is important, plus ideas for future development on¬†Blink/Chromium.

Felipe Erias

The 'Ugly, Geeky War' for Web Privacy Is Playing Out in the¬†W3C ‚Äî The inside story of how the World Wide Web Consortium became a key battleground in the global fight for web¬†privacy.

Issie Lapowsky

Unlock the Power of Your Frontend Logs with LogDNA ‚Äî Frontend developers can easily ingest browser logs, collect the diagnostic data that they need to understand when and why the user experience is degraded, and view browser data in context with other services (both on the client and server¬†side).

LogDNA sponsor

Getting Lively: Firefox 90 Released ‚Äî Plenty of JavaScript additions in this release, including private fields and methods for classes, String and TypedArray global objects, and more. The full developer release notes are¬†here.

Ruth John (Mozilla)

An Introduction to CSS Refactoring ‚Äî The first in a three-part series going through the CSS refactor process from the beginning to¬†end.

Adrian Bece

Using HSL Colors in CSS ‚Äî A handy primer that explains what HSL is, and how to use it, along with some useful use-cases and examples that you can use right away in your current¬†projects.

Ahmad Shadeed

OMG, SVG Favicons FTW ‚Äî Explores the fun to be had with SVG favicons. Covers adding them to HTML, using emojis, inlining them as data URIs, and supporting dark¬†mode.

Austin Gil

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • As mentioned above, Firefox 90 is now available and it supports Fetch Metadata Request Headers which allow web apps to protect themselves against various cross-origin threats.
  • Here's how the team behind the UK Government's sprawling website are working to make links easier to see and read.
  • Some pretty amusing examples of how important visual hierarchy can be when designing with text.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Building a Dynamic Header with Intersection Observer ‚Äî Ever needed to have a component respond to elements as they‚Äôre scrolled to a certain threshold within the viewport? In JavaScript, attaching an event listener to constantly fire on scroll can be performance-intensive. There‚Äôs a better way with Intersection¬†Observer.

Michelle Barker

Organize Your CSS Declarations Alphabetically ‚Äî There are a few schools of thought when it comes to organizing your CSS declarations, with the most common being‚Ä¶ doing nothing. Eric makes the pitch for alphabetical order ‚Äúbecause it imposes a baseline sense of¬†structure‚Äù.

Eric Bailey

The Large, Small, and Dynamic Viewports ‚Äî A look at some of the changes being proposed regarding viewport units that will finally solve that irksome ‚Äò100vh in Safari on iOS‚Äô issue.

Bramus Van Damme

Monitor Key Frontend Performance Metrics with Datadog ‚Äî Collect your user sessions (no sampling) and receive actionable alerts in real time with Datadog. Start a free trial¬†today.

Datadog sponsor

Using the Specificity of :where() as a CSS Reset ‚Äî How you can make use of the :where() pseudo selector to change specificity¬†rules.

Mojtaba Seyedi

Screen Readers: Hearing The Unseen ‚Äî ‚Äúas responsible developers, we need to treat the accessibility of our applications the same way we treat the visual attractiveness and usefulness of the graphical user interfaces we¬†build‚Äù

Maciej Walaszczyk

What's The Difference Between The Alignment Values of start, flex-start, and self-start? ‚Äî Find out the difference between these alignment values in¬†flexbox.

Rachel Andrew

The Dilemma of Naming Font Size Variables ‚Äî Is something like $mouse and $elephant a clear way to declare font size differences? Martin Lexelius ponders such¬†things.

CSS-Tricks

Making A Strong Case For Accessibility ‚Äî How to implement and advocate for accessibility from the inception of a project to the release or handoff and¬†beyond.

Todd Libby

Get Started with the Best React Component Libraries in¬†<¬†7¬†Minutes

Retool sponsor

Pairing Fonts: Three Ways to Find Great Typeface Combinations
Oliver Sch√∂ndorfer

Web Designers Grapple With Downside to Flashy Animation: Motion Sickness

A CSS Carousel with Snapping Points and A Scroll-Linked Navigation
Fabrizio Calderan

My Struggle to Use and Animate a Conic Gradient in SVG
Amit Sheen

Node.js Engineer (Fully Remote) ‚Äî Looking for someone with a passion for programming and writing beautiful code to join our exceptional Engineering¬†group.
SignalWire

X-Team

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

AVPress: An In-Browser Video Compressor ‚Äî 100% client-side and it includes a number of different settings and presets you can define including the ability to trim or crop the¬†video.

Addy Osmani

Sequencer64: An Experimental Music Creation Tool that Works Offline as a PWA ‚Äî Try it here. Includes nine instrument ‚Äúkits‚Äù and you can save or download your¬†creations.

Nick Carbone

Vechai UI: A Set of High-Quality Accessible React UI Components ‚Äî Includes built-in dark mode and theme customization. All components are styled with Tailwind and you can try them¬†here.

items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã498 ‚Äî July 7, 2021 | Read on the web

When a Click is Not Just a Click ‚Äî There are nuances to consider when listening for a click event (such as a ‚Äòclick‚Äô sent from a keyboard versus one from a mouse). This post dives into how you can distinguish different types, and what opportunities arise from identifying¬†them.

Travis Almand

RenderingNG: Ready for The Next Generation of Web Content ‚Äî Chrome‚Äôs rendering lead outlines how work on the next-generation of rendering architecture for Chromium is nearing completion. They are hoping to ‚Äúcomplete the process of designing, building and shipping this architecture‚Äù in¬†2021.

Chris Harrelson

Learn to Build Scalable React Apps ‚Äî Brian Holt covers the latest tools in the React ecosystem like TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Redux, Jest, and more in this new and updated video¬†course.

Frontend Masters sponsor

The Internet Is Rotting ‚Äî Link rot and content drift is a massive growing issue for the web as a whole, and sadly too much has been lost¬†already. Funnily enough, I remember reading Jakob Nielsen complaining about this problem 23 years ago¬†too!

Jonathan Zittrain

A Complete Guide to Grid ‚Äî This comprehensive guide to CSS Grid has recently been updated. It focuses on all the settings both for the grid parent container and the grid child elements. A valuable resource worth¬†bookmarking.

Chris House

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Here are the release notes for Safari Technology Preview 127.
  • Talking of Safari, it now has a CSS Grid inspector.
  • Chris Coyier shares some of the WordPress plugins he finds compelling in this Twitter thread.
  • Typetura is a neat new typesetting tool for the web, this brief video does a great job of demoing it.
  • This W3C document has over 100 counter-style code snippets for a range of languages and cultures that can be dropped into your style declarations.
  • If digging into these sorta things is your jam, here's the CSS Fonts Module Level 5 public working draft from the W3C.
  • That Tim Berners-Lee NFT sold for just over $5 million.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Building a Responsive Layout with CSS Grid and Container Queries ‚Äî Watch along as Steph Eckles creates a layout that starts as a standard grid and gets additional styles (if the browser supports container¬†queries).

Alex Trost

Improving Cumulative Layout Shift at Telegraph Media Group ‚Äî How The Telegraph, a leading UK news website, managed to reduce their CLS scores by¬†250%.

Chris Boakes

Stop Using ‚ÄòPop-up‚Äô ‚Äî When you say pop-up do you mean a new window, a browser dialog, a tool-tip, or maybe something else? Adrian pleads with us to choose a term that accurately describes the control you¬†want.

Adrian Roselli

Monitor Lighthouse Scores and Core Web Vitals ‚Äî DebugBear continuously monitors site speed and provides front-end developers with the data they need to improve¬†it.

DebugBear sponsor

Experimenting with WebTransport ‚Äî A new API offering low-latency, bidirectional, client-server¬†messaging.

Jeff Posnick

Improving CSS Variables in WebKit
Tyler Wilcock

Adding Shadows to SVG Icons With CSS and SVG Filters
Joel Olawanle

Creating A Scalable "Star Rating" Without JS (and No SVG/Image for the Star)
Temani Afif

Animate On Scroll using IntersectionObserver
Keerthi

Jobs

Senior Frontend Developer (Vue, Nuxt) - Remote ‚Äî We‚Äôre seeking an engineer to join our team at Upwork. You‚Äôll be building apps (using Vue & Nuxt) that are used by millions of our users¬†daily.
Upwork

Frontend Engineer (React, New York) ‚Äî Dovetale helps Shopify merchants like KontrolFreek and Italic grow their creator community. Built in NYC and backed by Uber¬†founders.
Dovetale

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Introducing Flicking V4 with More Customization and UI Preserving ‚Äî Here‚Äôs a major new version of Naver‚Äôs popular open source carousel¬†library.

Wood Neck

GradientArt: An Advanced CSS Gradient Editor ‚Äî This is a gorgeous visual gradient editor that lets you customize just about every aspect of a CSS gradient‚Äôs properties. You can even quickly scale, rotate, or reposition the gradient as needed before grabbing the¬†CSS.

Yoav Kadosh

Typographic Scale Calculator: Choose The Right Font Size From A Harmonious Type Scale (Inspired by The Way Music Works) ‚Äî Choose a base font size, ratio, and scale and the values are generated automatically. A similar tool is found here.

Jean-Lou D√©sir√©

Milkdown: A Plugin-Driven WYSIWYG Markdown Editor ‚Äî Built on top of CodeMirror, the plugin system lets you easily enable or disable features like tables, LaTex support, and slash commands. Try it out¬†here.

Saul Mirone

margin-margin-revolution.css: A Game to Help You Never Forget the Order of Margins in CSS ‚Äî Ha! It's a sort of plain text version of Dance Dance Revolution.

Chris Johnson

Free Chat/Messaging UI Kits for Your Website or App

Stream sponsor

Content Placeholder for Tailwind CSS ‚Äî This Tailwind plugin adds utility classes for showing placeholders during a ‚Äòloading‚Äô state for your UI¬†elements.

Javis V. P√©rez

Instant Vitals: Tools to Track Core Web Vitals Metrics

Instant Domain Search

üï∞ ICYMI (Older links still worth checking out)

The Simplest Way to Download SVG/DOM Elements ‚Äî An easy, practical guide on how to download SVG or any DOM element as SVG, PNG or¬†PDF.
Fabian Wolff

The Future of Web Software Is HTML-Over-WebSockets ‚Äî HTML-over-Websockets continues having a moment -¬†here's the history of how we got here, and why the new approach takes the best of that history to make the¬†future.
Matt E. Patterson

Measuring Frontend Latency: A Strategy to Simplify The Complex ‚Äî How retailer Glossier got serious about measuring web performance; enabling them to reduce latency by nearly a¬†third.
Aaron Suggs

Intrinsic Typography is the Future of Styling Text on the Web

Testing Fonts for Accessibility

items.title: How you can use next-gen image formats in CSS now
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã497 ‚Äî June 30, 2021 | Read on the web

Detecting Hover-Capable Devices ‚Äî A good look, complete with code examples, at how some new media queries (part of the CSS Level 5 Media Queries spec) can help us target based on input¬†device.

Michelle Barker

Meet :has, A Native CSS Parent Selector (And More) ‚Äî A detailed look at the early spec of the :has selector, and how it should improve the CSS workflow once it‚Äôs¬†released.

Adrian Bece

The CSV Importer You‚Äôll Love to Build ‚Äî Flatfile integrates with your app, in minutes, to auto-validate and transform messy spreadsheet data. The slick import wizard guides users through an intuitive import flow and enables your users to import their own spreadsheet data, with¬†confidence.

Flatfile Portal sponsor

Using Performant Next-Gen Images in CSS with image-set ‚Äî How you can use the image-set() function to adopt the latest image formats in CSS while still catering for older¬†browsers.

Ollie Williams

Web History: Community ‚Äî We‚Äôve been sharing Jay‚Äôs regular write-ups on the history of the web, and the latest, looking at all things community (think bulletin boards, GeoCities, NeoPets, etc) is out now. An always excellent chronicle, the series is well worth catching up¬†on.

Jay Hoffmann

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Version 6.3 of popular component builder Storybook UI is out now.
  • Google has delayed its plans to block third-party cookies in Chrome until at least 2023.
  • This Core Web Vitals report is worth playing around with ‚Äî it uses data from the HTTP Archive to highlight how different technologies fare on the new page experience metrics.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Media Queries in Times of @container ‚Äî With container queries now on the horizon - will we need media queries at all? The author explores use cases where @container probably won‚Äôt fit.

Max B√∂ck

Overlay Fact Sheet ‚Äî A lot of notable signatories from the frontend world on this open letter/information sheet aimed at educating on web-accessibility¬†overlays.

Karl Groves

Chrome Extensions: Clarifying Extension Policies for A Safer, More Consistent Web Store ‚Äî An update from the Chrome team on refreshed security requirements and clarifications on policy to keep the quality of extensions high, and the experience for developers¬†consistent.

Rebecca Soares and Benjamin Ackerman (Google)

CSS Frameworks in Vogue, But Don't Forget Style Fundamentals ‚Äî Yes, CSS frameworks are here to stay, but Richard reminds us not to become overly-reliant on frameworks and to learn the fundamentals below the¬†abstractions.

Richard MacManus

Accessible Design: How Much Motion Is Too Much Motion? ‚Äî A process breakdown of how to create Accessibility compliant interaction design within a¬†framework.

Heather Waroff

Google No Longer Requires Publishers to Use The AMP Format. Bad News: What Replaces It Might Be Worse

Scott Gilbertson opinion

Remove Guesswork from Website Bugs with Screenshots and Technical Info

Bugherd sponsor

Tips & Tricks for Testing Accessibility with Assistive Technologies
Karl Groves

Cypress or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love E2E
Emma Fabre

The Master Guide to Smooth, Realistic Shadows in CSS
Devang Saklani

Using CSS with ARIA to Enforce Accessibility
Adrian Roselli

Jobs

Senior Front End Engineer ‚Äî Austin startup protecting consumers from unwanted telemarketing. Hard problems, large scale, world-class team. JavaScript,¬†Vue.js.
ActiveProspect

items.title: Jake and Surma look at ten Web performance pitfalls
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã496 ‚Äî June 23, 2021 | Read on the web

A History of the Web ‚Äî Matthew shares a look back at how the web has evolved into what we have today (going from the first HTML spec, right up to modern day React), along with thoughts as to why building web applications is so hard here in¬†2021.

Matthew Gerstman

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Top 10 Web Performance Pitfalls ‚Äî Jake and Surma run through some of the top web performance issues they‚Äôve seen recently across a bunch of¬†sites.

Google Chrome Developers

Resolve Bugs and Manage Website Feedback Fast with BugHerd ‚Äî Simple, effective QA and user acceptance testing. Pin bugs and feedback to your website. BugHerd captures all the technical information you need to replicate bugs and solve issues like a screenshot, and browser and OS¬†information.

BugHerd sponsor

Brave Unveils New 'Brave Search' Search Engine ‚Äî Brave, perhaps better known for its privacy oriented browser, has unveiled Brave Search, a new privacy-oriented search engine of its own. Their biggest claim is it‚Äôs built upon ‚Äúa completely independent index‚Äù and there‚Äôs no tracking at¬†all.

Brave

A Complete Guide To Accessibility Tooling ‚Äî A look into different kinds of tools to help you streamline your accessibility testing¬†process.

Nic Chan

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Microsoft and Google have collaborated to bring support for dark mode form controls to Chromium.
  • AMP is no longer an eligibility factor when ranking in Google search.
  • This page from Marko Denic has a ton of handy HTML tips that are worth remembering.
  • Tim Berners-Lee has defended his decision to auction an NFT representing the 'source code' to the web.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Custom Scrollbars In CSS ‚Äî You may have spotted these and been curious about how to do it yourself. Ahmad does a great job of running through both the old and new way to style these custom scrollbars here, with plenty of¬†details and visual examples.

Ahmad Shadeed

Let's Learn About Aspect Ratios in CSS ‚Äî Another from Ahmad, this time looking at how to use the native CSS aspect-ratio¬†property.

Ahmad Shadeed

Optical Size, The Hidden Superpower of Variable Fonts ‚Äî A font with an optical size axis allows for more detail to be shown when used at larger sizes. Neat.

Roel Nieskens

Watch Gavin Strange‚Äôs Series of Design Classes on Editor X

Editor X sponsor

Towards a Better Responsiveness Metric ‚Äî The Chrome Speed Metrics team shares some ideas around improving how they measure responsiveness, and ask for your feedback on the¬†matter.

Moreno, Sullivan, Song

Perfect Tooltips with CSS Clipping and Masking
Louis Hoebregts

A Comprehensive Guide to Front End Testing
Perfecto

Detect Unused Classes in... HTML
Chris Coyier

Jobs

Senior Front End Engineer at Sakari (San Francisco) ‚Äî Build the Next-Gen Messaging Platform. Join our small agile team to help build chatbots, AI & voice using React, Mongo &¬†Node.js.
Sakari

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

TOAST UI Editor 3.0 Is Here ‚Äî The latest version of a popular open-source JavaScript library for editing Markdown documents through both text and WYSIWYG. Has things like syntax highlighting, scroll syncing, live preview, chart support, and more.

TOAST UI

Useful Front-End Boilerplates and Starter Kits ‚Äî We don‚Äôt need to write everything from scratch every single time. With boilerplates and starter kits, we can set up our projects faster, and get to work¬†immediately.

Cosima Mielke

What Are the Best React Component Libraries? ‚Äî Our team researched the best React component libraries so you don‚Äôt have¬†to.

Retool sponsor

Utopia: A New Browser-Based React IDE ‚Äî Although only in alpha release, Utopia makes a positive first impression. The founding principle of the new browser-based IDE is that design and coding processes should be fully integrated from the outset with easy, two way navigation between the two. Take a test drive with the 'Play with Utopia' button on their landing page. There was a lot of discussion about this tool on Hacker News, too.

Utopia

Pintr: Generate Single-Line SVG Illustrations from a Photo ‚Äî You can select the level of contrast and definition then download in PNG or SVG¬†format.

Javier B√≥rquez

Concentric Circle Spinner ‚Äî A cool spinner made only with divs, some border tricks, and one CSS¬†animation.

Alex Trost (via Luke Richardville)

snappify: Create Images of Beautiful Code Snippets ‚Äî There are a few of these types of tools available. This one includes a number of different options for customizing the color, syntax, background, etc, of the code¬†blocks.

Anki and Dominik

Testing Playground: A Simple and Complete DOM Testing Playground That Encourages Good Testing Practices ‚Äî Based on Testing Library, which we‚Äôve featured before. Similar to a JS fiddle-type environment, but with a focus on¬†testing.

Stephan Meijer
